qa_pairs.question: What is the formula for calculating the coupon holder length (L) for top of the line monitoring?
qa_pairs.evaluation_criteria: Correctly identifies the formula for top of the line monitoring. Includes all variables and their definitions.  Incorrect answers may omit variables or provide the wrong formula.
qa_pairs.answer: The formula is L = (A + PW + WG) - 2.5", where L is the coupon holder length, A is the length of the flare-weld access fitting body, PW is the pipe wall thickness, and WG is the weld gap.

  {
    "answer": "A = Length of Flare-weld Access fitting body, PW = Pipe wall (wall thickness of pipe), PD = Pipe diameter (outside diameter of pipe), EL = Effective length of coupon (the portion of the coupon exposed to the environment, i.e. 3\" coupon = 1-5%\", 6\" coupon = 4-3/4\"), WG = Weld gap (as per weld procedures, 1/16\" is normal per ANSI B31.1 1973)",
